claimsguide-text: Claims & Land Ownership Guide Now you're getting somewhere! In Multiplayer Vintage Story, you have the ability to Claim Land to protect your builds from harm. This is a very important step to keep unwanted Players from stealing your items or, even worse, claim your home for themselves! Getting Started with Claims /land claim new Use to start a New Claim and mark the Start Point. /land claim start Mark the Start Point corner of your Claim. /land claim end Mark the End Point corner of your Claim. Once both corners are marked, a yellow cuboid will appear showing the area of the Claim. You can fine tune the area with these direction commands: Note: Do not type the Square [ ] Brackets! /land claim g[n/e/s/w/u/d] to grow and /land claim s[n/e/s/w/u/d] to shrink your Claim Area. For example, you would use "/land claim gu 2" to grow your Claim Area UP by 2 blocks and "/land claim sn" to shrink your Claim Area's North Side by 1 block. /land claim add This will add your current Claim Area to the Claim. The yellow cuboid will turn green. You may now finalize your claim or add more Claim Areas. /land claim save [claimName] This will finalize and Save your Claim with given Name. The Name is Optional. /land list Lists all of your current claims showing their Index Number. /land claim load [index] Loads the claim with assigned Index Number. /land free [index] This will Delete claim with assigned Index Number. Must be confirmed with /land free [index] confirm. Granting Access to Players and Player Groups First, load your claim with /land claim load [index]. /land claim grant [playerName] [use/all] This will grant the Player with either use-Can open doors, chests, pickup things OR all-Can build and break blocks. /land claim revoke [playerName] This will revoke any permissions from the Player. /land claim grantgroup [groupName] [use/all] This will grant the Group with either use-Can open doors, chests, pickup things OR all-Can build and break blocks. All Players in or added to the Group get that permission only while in the Group. /land claim revokegroup [groupName] This will revoke any permissions from the Group. /land claim save [claimName] Be sure to Save your Claim again with the name you gave it.
pettamingguide-text: Pet Ownership Guide - How to tame a creature A Seraph's best friend. Owning a pet can be rewarding in all sorts of ways. Bighorn Sheep can be ridden, allowing for faster travel across the land. Cats frighten weaker Drifters so much they cower in fear. Dogs will protect you from evil, and even carry your burdens. "Who's a good boy!?!" Obtaining a pet is rather simple: In the wild or in your animal pen, find a creature's offspring and feed it something it likes. You can tell when an animal is tamable with the feeding tooltip above them. This will also show things the animal likes. When fed, you'll receive a message with the tame progess. Once tamed, you will be prompted to name your new best friend. Continuing to feed them will increase their Obedience level. Most commands can only be executed once a certain level of obedience is reached. Press your Sprint Key + right-click on your pet to get a listing of all available commands. The Pet whistle allows you to issue commands from a distance. The higher the Generation of a pet, the lower the obedience drain until it no longer drains. When tired, your pets will prefer sleeping in certain spots, such as linen, rush mats and cushions. There are a few accessories available to aid you in making your pet a little bit more dapper looking. Be careful and protect your Pets, as they can die, and will not respawn! If your pet does die, their corpse will persist for about 60 days before they rot away. That will give you grieving owners plenty of time to secure a Poultice or Bandage to revive your pet, keeping them in this realm for a while longer. Pets ARE NOT harvestable. Meaning if some terrible person kills your pet, you'll see exactly who did it and can warn all with a nice screenshot. Tamable Creatures And Their Foods Bighorn Sheep: Salt, Dry Grass, Heather, Orange Mallow, Redtop Grass, Cow Parsley, Dwarf Furze, Woad and Herbivore Pet Cookies. Cats: Raw Redmeat, Raw Bushmeat, Raw Poultry, Raw Fish and Carnivore Pet Cookies. Direwolves: Bones, Raw Redmeat, Raw Bushmeat, Raw Poultry and Carnivore Pet Cookies. Foxes: Blueberries, Cranberries, Currants, Raw Chicken Eggs, Raw Redmeat, Raw Bushmeat, Raw Poultry, Raw Fish and Carnivore Pet Cookies. Raccoons: Grubs, Termites, Blueberries, Cranberries, Currants, Raw Chicken Eggs and Honeycombs. Wolves: Bones, Raw Redmeat, Raw Bushmeat, Raw Poultry and Carnivore Pet Cookies.
chatgroupsguide-text: Player Chat Groups Guide For all of my Friends; Me, Myself and I. Player Chat Groups are private groups where the members get a new chat tab to talk with each other without cluttering up the General Chat. Most uses for Player Chat Groups would be for Villages, Streamer Chats and even granting Claim Permission to all within a Group. Note: Do not type the Square [ ] Brackets! /group create [groupName] Creates a new Player Chat Group with given name. /group invite [groupName] [playerName] Invites the Player to the Group. Note: Invites do not currently appear anywhere. /group acceptinvite [groupName] Accepts an Invite for the Group. /group leave [groupName] Leave the Group. /group list Lists all Groups you are currently in. /group info [groupName] Lists the players of a Group. /group rename [oldGroupName] [newGroupName] Rename the Group. /group kick [groupName] [playerName] Remove the Player from the Group. /group op [groupName] [playerName] Grant Operator Status to the Player of the Group. /group deop [groupName] [playerName] Revoke Operator Status from the Player of the Group. /group disband [groupName] Destroys the Group. Must be Group Owner to use.
